variant.p: Paragraph 63 of IAS 19 is based on the definition of, and recognition criteria for, a liability in the IASC’s Framework for the Preparation and Presentation of Financial Statements (Framework). The Framework defined a liability as ‘a present obligation of the entity arising from past events, the settlement of which is expected to result in an outflow from the entity of resources embodying economic benefits’. The Framework stated that an item which meets the definition of a liability should be recognised if:

li.p: it is probable that any future economic benefit associated with the item will flow from the entity; and
the item has a cost or value that can be measured with reliability.
